meanings.definition: To take care of someone's house while they are away.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor housesits for us when we go on vacation.
meanings.sent2: She always housesits for her friends when they travel.
meanings.sent3: The responsible teenager housesits for the elderly couple down the street.
meanings.sent4: As a professional housesitter, she housesits mansions for wealthy clients.
meanings.sent5: He housesits with great care and attention to detail.

meanings.definition: The act of staying in someone's house and taking care of it while they are away.
meanings.sent1: House-sitting can be a fun way to earn extra money.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys doing housesits for friends during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The housesits in our neighborhood are always reliable and trustworthy.
meanings.sent4: The housesits in this area are known for their dedication and reliability.
meanings.sent5: She has done many housesits and gained valuable experience.
